wikipedia_page.main: Margaret Elphinstone (born 1948) is a Scottish author of novels, short stories and poetry. She is known especially for The Sea Road, a re-telling of the Viking exploration of the North Atlantic.

response: * Her tale is told in the novel 'Gudrid the Fair' by Maurice Hewlett, and in The Sea Road by Scottish writer Margaret Elphinstone (Canongate Books, 2000)
Margaret Elphinstone wrote a novel, Hy Brasil (2002), about a woman who is sent to write the first-ever travel book on Hy Brasil.
* Hy Brazil: is a mythical island used as inspiration for Margaret Elphinstone's 2002 novel of that title

Voyageurs is the title of the 2003 novel by Scottish writer Margaret Elphinstone. It sets a young Quaker farmer from rural England in search of his missing missionary sister; he must work as a voyageur to have any hope of finding her.
